paragraph: David Vélez (born in 1973 in Bogotá, Colombia) is a sound artist/composer.
David Vélez was born in Bogotá. He moved to NYC in 2002 and returned to Colombia in 2010.
He has an MA in Fine Arts from the Universidad Nacional de Boogotá.
He started to publish his work in 2005 with his project Lezrod. His album 'Retorno a la nada' was nominated for the Qwartz awards.
Since 2006, Vélez has participated in a series of exhibitions and art festivals such as:
The 'Proyecto de Visualización de Honda' (Honda, Colombia 2014) with the 4-18 Foundation
Frecuencias’ (2012 Plazarte Gallery, Medellín) also with the 4-18 Foundation,
‘Cacería de Brujas’ (2011, Bogotá), ’Densidades’ (2011 Universidad de los Andes, Bogotá),
Internacional Ruidística (2010 Valenzuela Klenner Gallery, Bogotá),

Photophono (NYC, 2006). David Vélez works as content manager, curator and publisher for Impulsive Habitat a label he cofounded in 2009 that focuses on the publication of phonographic and musique concréte works.
In 2011, he funded the journal The Field Reporter which is focused on the criticism and review of phonographic and musique concrete based works.
DataTransfer2  -with VA- (2007 Ekonetlabel-France / 2010 Impulsive habitat Reissues - Portugal)
Sueños en plasma  (2011 self release - Colombia)
Cuatro horas en el páramo-  (2011 Green Field Recordings -Portugal)
La ciudad de Tar  (2011 Contour Editions -US)
